description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Cory Booker breaks the record for longest Senate speech, previously held by segregationist Strom Thurmond.
title: Cory Booker Breaks Record for Longest Senate Speech

description: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong urged universities to seek greater research cooperation with partners outside the US following the Trump administration’s threat of funding cuts to the sector.
title: Australia Urges Universities to Diversify Research Away From US

description: A group of 50 Republican and Democratic senators introduced a sanctions package to hit Russia and countries that buy its oil if President Vladimir Putin refuses to engage in good-faith ceasefire negotiations with Ukraine or breaches an eventual agreement.
title: Bipartisan Group of Senators Readies New Sanctions to Hit Russia

description: President Donald Trump will meet on Wednesday to consider a proposal for divesting TikTok’s US operations from Chinese parent company ByteDance Ltd., just days ahead of a deadline for a sale of the popular social media app, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Weigh Plans for TikTok Sale at Meeting on Wednesday

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has ordered additional forces to the Middle East, including the Carl Vinson carrier strike group and aircraft, as the US vows to continue its strikes against Iran-backed Houthi rebels and as tensions with Tehran are increasing over its nuclear program.
title: Pentagon Sends Second Aircraft Carrier to Mideast as Iran Tensions Rise

description: Willkie Farr & Gallagher is committing at least $100 million in pro bono work to causes aligned to “conservative ideals,” President Donald Trump said Tuesday.
title: Trump Strikes Deal With Willkie, Law Firm of Doug Emhoff

description: Washington Governor Bob Ferguson said he wouldn’t sign a budget that relies on the wealth tax proposed by his fellow Democrats in the state legislature.
title: Washington Wealth Tax Wouldn’t Survive Legal Test, Governor Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Alicia Diaz looks at the state of play at the Capitol on the day before the president’s big tariff announcement. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Starting to Stir Some Republican Unease

description: President Donald Trump is flirting with extending his stay at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue.
title: Can President Trump Serve More Than Two Terms?

description: Republicans are in the process of drafting a tax bill behind closed doors that includes an increase of the state and local tax deduction to as high as $25,000 for an individual, according to people familiar with the plan.
title: Republicans Eye $25,000 SALT Cap as Trump’s Tax Cuts Take Shape

description: The State Department told Congress it has approved a possible $5.6 billion sale of F-16 fighter jets to the Philippines, a move that would send US warplanes to a key ally in Southeast Asia that has clashed with China.
title: US State Department Approves $5.6 Billion in F-16s for Philippines

description: A Heritage Foundation-linked group is seeking to leverage President Donald Trump’s torrent of executive actions against law firms to get free legal help for conservative causes.
title: Conservative Group Asks Law Firms for Free Help, Noting Trump’s Attacks

description: In 1998, then 27-year-old detective Peter Dutton was pursuing an escaped prisoner in a high-speed chase through the streets of Brisbane when his car flipped and slid into a building.
title: Ex-Cop Rises as Australia Opposition Seeks to Defeat PM Albanese

description: A South African delegation returned home after meeting with US officials to mend ties between the two nations that have become increasingly strained since President Donald Trump took office in January.
title: South African Delegation Meets With US Officials to Mend Ties

description: A panel of South African lawmakers approved a fiscal framework that underpins the national budget, while calling on Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana to relook at his proposal to increase value-added tax.
title: South Africa Panel Backs Fiscal Plan, Wants Review of VAT Hike

description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has emerged as a key player in determining the future of United States Steel Corp., holding back-to-back meetings with rival bidders for the American steelmaker last week.
title: Lutnick Fields Rival US Steel Bids by Nippon Steel, Activist

description: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander, the investment adviser to the city’s five pension funds, accused Tesla Inc. of misrepresenting chief executive officer Elon Musk’s involvement in the company.
title: Musk’s DOGE Work Hurts Tesla Shareholders, NYC Comptroller Says

description: The Paris court of appeals said that it should be able to deliver a ruling by the summer of 2026 in the case of misused EU funds related to far-right leader Marine Le Pen.
title: French Appeals Court Expects to Rule on Le Pen Case by Mid-2026

description: President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs will take immediate effect after they are announced Wednesday, his top spokeswoman said.
title: Trump’s April 2 Tariffs to Take Immediate Effect, White House Says

description: Princeton University said US government agencies have frozen several dozen research grants as President Donald Trump escalates his fight with elite American colleges.
title: Princeton Says US Agencies Have Suspended Dozens of Grants

description: The US is targeting Quebec’s controversial French-language law as a barrier to trade, a move that may further complicate Canada’s decisions in responding to President Donald Trump’s tariffs.
title: US Trade Office Takes Aim at Quebec’s French-Language Law

description: The Trump administration said it made an “administrative error” in deporting a suspected MS-13 gang member to an El Salvador prison despite an immigration judge’s order barring his removal to that nation.
title: Trump Officials Admit Error in Deporting Suspected MS-13 Member

description: Sen. Cory Booker is delivering a marathon speech critical of President Donald Trump, holding the Senate floor overnight as he and other Democrats seek to address the clamor among party loyalists to fight harder and more visibly against administration policies.
title: Booker Grabs Spotlight in Marathon Senate Speech Slamming Trump

description: Mercedes-Benz Group AG is considering withdrawing its least expensive cars from the US because President Donald Trump’s auto tariffs would likely make their sales economically unfeasible, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Mercedes Weighs Pulling US Entry-Level Cars Over Trump Tariffs

description: Jeanne Marrazzo, Anthony Fauci’s successor at the National Institutes of Health, was placed on administrative leave starting on Tuesday and offered a reassignment to a different part of the US Department of Health and Human Services, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Fauci’s Successor Put on Leave as RFK Jr. Reshapes Agencies

description: The UK put Russia in the top tier of its new Foreign Influence Registration Scheme, meaning anyone working for the Russian state in Britain will need to declare their activity or face jail.
title: UK Tightens Rules for Russian Agents After Hybrid Attacks

description: Some federal departments are offering employees a second chance to accept a buyout offer, the latest effort to downsize the US government amid a wave of cuts spearheaded by Elon Musk.
title: Federal Workers Get Second Musk Buyout Offer

description: South Africa’s trade ministry will seek talks with the US as its auto industry braces for a hit from Washington’s new tariffs this week, saying the duties could hurt local manufacturers and the economy.
title: South Africa Seeks US Talks as Carmakers Face 25% Tariff Hit

description: Retired Air Force Lieutenant General Dan Caine, President Donald Trump’s nominee to be the nation’s highest-ranking military officer, acknowledged Tuesday that “I’m an unconventional nominee.”
title: Trump Pick for Joint Chiefs Says He’s ‘Unconventional Choice’

description: President Donald Trump’s trade war is threatening US dairy exports just as the industry needs new markets for its booming production.
title: Trump Tariffs Threaten $8.2 Billion American Dairy Exports

description: Lawyers representing five Venezuelans urged the US Supreme Court not to let President Donald Trump resume deportations of alleged gang members without hearings, saying the men are at risk of being held for life in a brutal foreign prison.
title: Venezuelans Urge US Supreme Court to Keep Deportations on Hold

description: Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Tom Barkin said President Donald Trump’s tariffs could raise both inflation and unemployment, creating a big challenge for the central bank.
title: Fed’s Barkin Says Tariffs Could Reduce Jobs and Raise Inflation

description: A Cornell University graduate student activist targeted by the Trump administration for deportation says he voluntarily left the country after losing a bid to block his removal.
title: Cornell Student Activist Fighting Deportation Has Left US

description: France’s far-right National Rally conceded the extent of the damage caused by a court ruling barring its leader, Marine Le Pen, from running for election. But the party insists that the fight isn’t over and that it will try to use the controversy to its advantage.
title: A Combative Le Pen Looks to Move Past France’s Election Ban

description: Strategas Securities Co-Founder Jason De Sena Trennert is no longer in the running to become US Treasury assistant secretary for financial markets, due to a newly discovered health issue, according to a statement to clients seen by Bloomberg News.
title: Trennert of Strategas Pulls Out of Treasury Job on Health Issue

description: State, county and city governments are eager to hire former federal agency staffers targeted in DOGE cuts. But matching worker skills to local needs is a challenge.
title: Local Governments Vie for Fired Federal Workers

description: President Donald Trump’s nominee to be the nation’s highest-ranking military officer said military force alone might not be enough to deter Iran from obtaining a nuclear weapon, according to a statement he provided ahead of his Senate confirmation hearing Tuesday.
title: Trump’s Joint Chiefs Pick Says Military Force Alone May Not Be Enough to Sway Iran

description: Portugal’s government plans to change public procurement rules for defense orders as it aims to make the process faster, Defense Minister Nuno Melo said.
title: Portugal to Change Public Procurement Rules for Defense Orders

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said artificial intelligence may undermine the region’s social model if countries don’t nurture the skills to harness such technology.
title: Lagarde Sees Danger That AI Could Breed Inequality in Europe

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s move to tax private school fees was described as an unprecedented crackdown that breaches the country’s human rights obligations, in the first substantial court challenge to the plan.
title: Starmer’s Tax on Private Schools Challenged in Court by Parents

description: The US Department of Health and Human Services started dismissing workers early Tuesday morning, according to a memo viewed by Bloomberg, carrying out Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s goal to shrink the agency.
title: US Health Agency Begins Mass Layoffs as RFK Jr. Orders 10,000 Jobs Cut

description: US Vice President JD Vance is planning to visit Italy later this month, as European leaders, including Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni, grapple with how to deal with the seismic foreign policy changes from President Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Vance Plans Rome Visit Amid Brewing Tensions With Europe

description: The UK government is bracing for US tariffs set to be outlined this week by President Donald Trump to hit the British economy, even as the two governments continue talks on a potential carve-out.
title: UK Prepares for US Tariffs Impact Amid ‘Advanced’ Carve-Out Talks

description: India takes barrels previously carried on US-sanctioned ships
title: Russian Crude Shipments Fall on Brief Halt at Key Pacific Port

description: When Michael Waltz ran for reelection in November in Florida’s 6th congressional district, the Republican trounced his Democratic opponent by more than 30 percentage points.
title: Republican Anxiety Grows as Florida Races Test Trump Strength

description: By the time Javier Milei sat down for dinner with his guests on the 22nd floor of Le Parc, a luxury skyscraper in Buenos Aires, the cash had already been collected — thick wads of hundred-dollar bills, totaling some $20,000 in all, stuffed in a bag held by his sister and business manager, Karina Milei.
title: Milei Charged $20,000 to Attend Private Dinners as Congressman

description: Finland’s government plans to raise the country’s defense spending to 3% of its economic output by 2029 to address the risks from a more aggressive Russia, Prime Minister Petteri Orpo said.
title: Finland to Raise Defense Spending and Exit Landmine Ban

description: For more than three decades, the pharmaceutical sector has been protected from tariffs by a World Trade Organization agreement designed to improve access to life-saving drugs.
title: Trump’s Pharma Threats Take Tariffs Into Uncharted Territory

description: Brazilians are laying the blame squarely on President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and his government for the economic pain caused by soaring food prices.
title: Brazilians Blame Lula’s Economic Policy for Surging Inflation

description: A probe into the “culture, structure and leadership” at the Office for National Statistics has been launched by the government amid growing concerns over the quality of its data.
title: UK Launches Investigation Into Problems at Statistics Office

description: A small, sidelined unit within Israel’s intelligence service that’s designed to challenge conventional thinking about strategic threats is being upgraded and given direct access to senior military officials in a bid to prevent a repeat of the failures that contributed to the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas.
title: Israel Plans to Expand Devil’s Advocate Unit After Gaza Failures

description: Colombia will offer shorter-maturity bonds and euro-denominated debt in an overhaul of its financing strategy, according to the nation’s new public credit director.
title: New Credit Chief Announces Overhaul of Colombia’s Debt Strategy

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Myanmar Junta Moves to Exploit Earthquake Chaos

description: China is willing to buy more Indian products to balance trade, Beijing’s Ambassador Xu Feihong said just ahead of a US tariff announcement expected to hit the south Asian neighbors.
title: China Ready to Buy More Products from India as US Tariffs Loom

description: French hotel group Accor SA has warned that forward bookings from Europe to the US are down 25% this summer as travelers that feel put off by US President Donald Trump’s crackdown on immigration divert to other locations.
title: European Tourists Start Avoiding the US as ‘Unknown Territory’

description: Elon Musk is seeking a repeat of the political victory he scored with President Donald Trump by deploying millions of dollars into what has become the most expensive judicial race in US history.
title: Elon Musk Pays Voters, Pours Cash Into $82 Million Wisconsin Race

description: Manufacturers and suppliers are bound by more than simple supply and demand. There are contracts, rules, laws, arbitration clauses and myriad other legal stipulations that smooth the flow of commerce.
title: Trump’s Tariff Upheaval Sparks Frenzy of Work for Trade Lawyers

description: Ukraine’s top diplomat said officials are pressing ahead with the US toward an “acceptable” economic accord hours after President Donald Trump accused Kyiv of trying to renegotiate the deal.
title: Ukraine Pushing Ahead on US Deal After Trump Renews Criticism

description: Turkey’s jailed opposition figurehead, Ekrem Imamoglu, urged supporters to boycott entities deemed to be linked to government circles, as protests continue following his arrest last month.
title: Erdogan’s Jailed Rival Calls For Boycott of State-Linked Brands

description: Tesla Inc. sales fell 37% in France last month as the electric-vehicle maker continued its poor performance in Europe, where Elon Musk’s involvement in politics and a model changeover have been major hindrances.
title: Tesla Extends European Slump With 37% Sales Drop in France

description: The Donald Trump administration highlighted India’s high tariffs on American farm goods just days before reciprocal duties kick in, putting further pressure on the South Asian nation to reduce curbs in its politically-sensitive agriculture sector.
title: US Slams High India Duties on Farm Goods Before April 2 Tariffs

description: Last month, Donald Trump fired the Federal Trade Commission’s two Democratic commissioners. They have since filed suit, arguing that the law that created the FTC — as well as a 90-year-old Supreme Court precedent — prevent the president from firing them without cause. And now, what might seem like a niche legal dispute could end up having much bigger consequences for other independent government agencies, including the Federal Reserve. That would be a huge shock for Wall Street, which tends to v
title: Odd Lots: The Growing Risk to Fed Independence (Podcast)

description: Can Trump fire the Fed chair?
title: The Growing Risk to Fed Independence That Wall St Isn't Watching

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s UK government insisted a boost to minimum wage rates will help Britons with the cost of living even as a slew of household bills rise.
title: Labour Touts UK Wage Gains as £600 Rise in Household Bills Bites

description: Russia’s Arctic liquefied natural gas plant appears to have flared fuel last week, satellite images show, a move that could indicate the restart of a sanctioned export facility that has effectively been shuttered since last October.
title: Sanctioned Russian Arctic LNG Plant Flares Gas After Long Lull

description: The value of Russian assets frozen by Swiss authorities jumped by 28% from a year earlier as the country embraced further European Union sanctions against hundreds of Russian individuals and companies deemed to be close to the Kremlin.
title: Swiss Froze 28% More Russian Assets in Past Year, Following EU

description: The European Union said it will use a broad range of options to retaliate against the US if President Donald Trump follows through on his threat to impose so-called reciprocal tariffs on the bloc this week.
title: EU Readies ‘Strong Plan’ Against Trump’s Global Tariff Strike

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s AD coalition led the opposition Socialists by a margin of 6.6 percentage points in an opinion poll, TVI reported on its website.
title: Portuguese Prime Minister’s Coalition Leads in Poll, TVI Reports

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu withdrew his nomination of an ex-admiral as director of the Shin Bet security service, 24 hours after it was announced.
title: Netanyahu Withdraws Ex-Admiral’s Nomination as Shin Bet Chief

description: South Africa’s rand gyrated as talks between the two main partners in the coalition government aimed at securing a deal on the national budget continued.
title: Rand Gyrates as South African Politicians Debate Crucial Budget

description: South Korea’s Constitutional Court will announce its verdict on President Yoon Suk Yeol’s impeachment on April 4, four months after his ill-fated decision to impose martial law. Yoon unleashed South Korea’s worst constitutional crisis in decades with the move, which he rescinded in six hours after parliament overturned it.
title: South Korea’s Top Political Leaders Face a Host of Legal Hurdles

description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has signaled he could withhold promised Chips Act grants as he pushes for companies in line for federal semiconductor subsidies to substantially expand their US projects, according to eight people familiar with the matter.
title: US Chip Grants In Limbo as Lutnick Pushes for Bigger Investments

description: The Israeli military conducted an airstrike on a Beirut suburb that targeted a Hezbollah operative, after hitting the Lebanese capital a few days ago in its first assault on the region since a ceasefire started in November.
title: Israel Says Hezbollah Operative Targeted in Beirut Suburb Strike

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has rejected a US trade body’s concerns over his nation’s biosecurity laws and subsidized medicine system, declaring that they are “not up for negotiation.”
title: Australian PM Says US Trade Targets Are ‘Not Up for Negotiation’

description: South Korea is poised to rule on the political fate of impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol, deciding whether to permanently remove him from office for his short-lived martial law decree or reinstate him.
title: South Korea to Rule on President Yoon’s Impeachment on Friday

description: The Trump administration’s tariffs may spell a big economic crisis for Japan, a senior lawmaker in Japan’s ruling party said, adding that the auto tariffs in particular would have huge implications across all regions in Japan.
title: Trump Tariffs May Spell Economic Crisis for Japan, Onodera Says

description: President Donald Trump said he plans to reach out to North Korea “at some point” and reiterated that he has a “very good relationship” with leader Kim Jong Un.
title: Trump Plans to Contact North Korea, Touting ‘Good Relationship’

description: South Korea’s acting president vetoed a landmark bill that would heighten corporate boards’ accountability to shareholders, siding with conglomerates in their dispute with reform advocates.
title: Korea Leader Vetoes Bill to Broaden Board Duties to Shareholders
